summary: This bill, the Methane Emissions Mitigation Research and Development Act, focuses on reducing methane emissions. It amends the Energy Policy Act of 2005 to direct the Secretary of Energy to establish programs for methane detection, quantification, and mitigation, including technical assistance, public resources for best practices, and research into improved technologies.  It also establishes a consortium for data sharing and research. Furthermore, the Secretary of Commerce, in consultation with the Secretary of Energy and the EPA, is instructed to establish national facilities to advance methane measurement standards. Funding is authorized for these initiatives.
